title: Jagan Reddy's Sister Launches YSR Telangana Party, Challenges KCR's Rule
content:
YS Sharmila, sister of Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy, has launched her own political party, the YSR Telangana Party, aiming to challenge the ruling Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) led by K Chandrashekhar Rao. 

Sharmila, who launched the party on her father's birth anniversary, promised to fulfill his welfare promises for the people of Telangana. She criticized KCR for failing to deliver on his promises, accusing him of neglecting the welfare of the people and leaving the state in a debt trap. 

Sharmila's party is focused on the welfare and development of Telangana, with a particular emphasis on women's empowerment. The party promises to reserve 50% of seats for women in the state Assembly and also work for the representation of Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, and minorities.

Sharmila also called on the Chief Ministers of Telangana and Andhra Pradesh to resolve the dispute over sharing of water from the Krishna river. She stressed that her party would fight for the fair share of water for Telangana while also ensuring that Andhra Pradesh's rights are not compromised.
author: Scroll Staff
